intro: Commiphora ararobba, commonly known as the Arabian myrrh tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes frankincense and myrrh-producing plants. The plant is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and small, leathery leaves. It produces a resinous sap that has been traditionally used for medicinal and aromatic purposes. This species thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils.
